bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. NUNES:H.R. 6539.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following: Congress has the power to enact thislegislation pursuant to the following: Article I, Section 8,provides Congress the power to regulate commerce with foreignnations.[Page H6279]

item.title: To establish trade negotiating objectives with respect to the application of sanitary and phytosanitary measures to agricultural products, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text: United States-Brazil Joint Commission on Commerce and Trade Act - Establishes the United States-Brazil Joint Commission on Commerce and Trade to address bilateral trade matters, seek removal of trade barriers, and promote commercial opportunities between the United States and Brazil.

bill.title: United States-Brazil Joint Commission on Commerce and Trade Act

item.title: United States-Brazil Joint Commission on Commerce and Trade Act
United States-Brazil Joint Commission on Commerce and Trade Act
To establish United States-Brazil Joint Commission on Commerce and Trade, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
